sentences.native: But Jane and Elizabeth, who agreed in wishing, for the sake of their sister's feelings and consequence, that she should be noticed on her marriage by her parents, urged him so earnestly yet so rationally and so mildly, to receive her and her husband at Longbourn, as soon as they were married, that he was prevailed on to think as they thought, and act as they wished.

sentences.target: Doch Jane und Elizabeth, die um der Gefühle und des Ansehens ihrer Schwester willen ebenfalls wünschten, daß die Eltern ihr zur Hochzeit ihre Aufmerksamkeit zuwenden sollten, baten den Vater so dringend und doch so vernünftig und sanft, sie und ihren Gatten in Longbourn zu empfangen, sobald sie verheiratet waren, daß er dazu bewogen wurde, ebenso wie sie zu denken und so zu handeln, wie sie es wünschten.
sentences.native: And their mother had the satisfaction of knowing that she would be able to show her married daughter in the neighbourhood before she was banished to the North.

sentences.target: Und ihre Mutter hatte die Befriedigung, daß sie nun ihre verheiratete Tochter in der Nachbarschaft zeigen konnte, ehe sie in den Norden verbannt wurde. Als Mr.
sentences.native: When Mr. Bennet wrote again to his brother, therefore, he sent his permission for them to come; and it was settled, that as soon as the ceremony was over, they should proceed to Longbourn.

sentences.target: Bennet wieder an seinen Schwager schrieb, ließ er ihnen bestellen, daß sie kommen dürften; und so wurde vereinbart, daß sie, sobald die Trauung vorüber war, nach Longbourn weiterfahren sollten.
sentences.native: Elizabeth was surprised, however, that Wickham should consent to such a scheme, and had she consulted only her own inclination, any meeting with him would have been the last object of her wishes.
